word_forms.definition_en: well-known to someone, usually because that thing or person has often been seen or heard

examples.example: Japanese cartoon characters such as Doraemon, Pikachu, and Totoro are familiar to kids all over the world.
examples.translate: 日本卡通人物，像是多啦A夢、皮卡丘和龍貓，全世界的小孩子都熟悉。

word_forms.definition_en: a strong desire to do something

examples.example: Jason had an urge to change his daily routine, so he went swimming after work instead of going straight home.
examples.translate: Jason有一股衝動想改變他的每天例行公事，所以他下班後去游泳，而沒有直接回家。

examples.example: Many people were urging the country’s leaders to do a better job of helping the homeless.
examples.translate: 許多人催促著這個國家的領導者，在幫助無家可歸的人這方面做得更好。

word_forms.definition_en: a plan or method used to achieve a certain aim

examples.example: The salesman’s strategy for closing a deal is to describe the features that make his products better than other companies’.
examples.translate: 這個業務達成買賣的策略是，描述比其他公司好的產品特色。

word_forms.definition_en: able to be seen

examples.example: In the sky there are 9,096 stars that are visible to the naked eye.
examples.translate: 天空中有 9,096 顆星星是肉眼可以看見的。

word_forms.definition_en: to buy

examples.example: Many people like to purchase goods inside international airports because they don’t need to pay taxes.
examples.translate: 許多人喜歡在國際機場內購買商品，因為他們不需付稅金。

examples.example: It is the cafe’s policy that each customer must make a purchase of at least one food or drink item.
examples.translate: 這家咖啡廳規定每位顧客至少要購買一樣食品或飲料。

word_forms.definition_en: (used for a product or business activity) able to make money

examples.example: The locals that live near this harbor have opened several highly profitable seafood restaurants.
examples.translate: 住在這個港口附近的當地人已經開了幾家高利潤的海產餐廳。

examples.example: The students really profited from the teacher’s story because they had a good laugh and learned something new.
examples.translate: 學生們真的從老師的故事中獲得好處，因為他們笑得很開心，而且學到了新東西。

examples.example: The couple hope to make a profit by selling their house for much more than they paid for it last year.
examples.translate: 這對夫妻希望能夠以高於去年買屋的房價來賣屋，以獲取利潤。

word_forms.definition_en: used to indicate that two or more facts, actions, statements, etc. are almost the same

examples.example: Many Arctic birds fly south when winter approaches. Similarly, monarch butterflies fly to warmer places during the cold season.
examples.translate: 許多極地地區的鳥在冬天來臨時飛往南方。同樣地，帝王斑蝶會在寒冷的季節期間，飛到比較溫暖的地方。

examples.example: These two kinds of fish are similar in appearance but taste quite different.
examples.translate: 這兩種魚在外表看起來很相似，但吃起來相當不一樣。

examples.example: When Blake traveled to foreign countries, he noticed the similarity of all people rather than what made them different.
examples.translate: 當Blake到外國旅行時，他注意到所有人的相似處，而非什麼使他們相異。

examples.example: One of the similarities between Austria and Germany is that the official language of both countries is German.
examples.translate: 奧地利和德國之間的相似處之一，就是這兩個國家的官方語言都是德語。

word_forms.definition_en: to direct something, such as information, a product, or some action, at a certain person or group of people

examples.example: This picture book is aimed primarily at children under the age of five.
examples.translate: 這本繪本主要針對五歲以下的兒童。

examples.example: The actress likes to watch videos of her performances with the aim of improving her acting skills.
examples.translate: 這位女演員喜歡觀看她自己演出的影片，目的是改進她的演技。

word_forms.definition_en: a sudden urge to do something, usually without thinking about the possible results

examples.example: Kate bought an expensive pair of shoes on impulse but later realized she didn’t need them.
examples.translate: Kate在衝動之下買了一雙很貴的鞋，但後來了解到她並不需要它們。

examples.example: The boy had an impulse to start laughing in the middle of the teacher’s lesson, but he managed to control it.
examples.translate: 這男孩有一股衝動想在老師的課堂中發笑，但他總算控制住沒笑。

word_forms.definition_en: to put something somewhere so people can easily see it

examples.example: The scooter shop displays some of its most popular models on the front sidewalk to attract potential buyers.
examples.translate: 這間機車行在店前的人行道上展示一些最受歡迎的機車車種，以吸引可能的買家。

examples.example: Some of Picasso’s less famous works will be on display at the Museum of Modern Art this spring.
examples.translate: 今年春天，畢卡索有一些較不知名的作品將會在現代藝術博物館展出。

examples.example: A trade fair allows a company to present a public display of the products it hopes to sell.
examples.translate: 一個貿易展讓一家公司能夠公開展出其所希望販賣的產品。

word_forms.definition_en: a discounted price for something, usually for a short period of time

examples.example: The buy-two-get-one-free offer on all baked items at this bakery will only last until October 31.
examples.translate: 在這間麵包店裡，所有烘焙產品買二送一的特價，將只持續到十月三十一日。

examples.example: The coach offered the best words of encouragement he could think of to each member of the team.
examples.translate: 這位教練提供了他所能想得到最佳的鼓勵話語給隊上的每位成員。

word_forms.definition_en: a person or company that buys goods or services from a shop or business

examples.example: Mrs. Stewart is used to dealing with angry people because she handles all the customer complaints for a large store.
examples.translate: Stewart太太習慣應付生氣的人，因為她為一間大商店處理所有的客訴。

word_forms.definition_en: something that helps one be better or more successful than others

examples.example: It would be to the company’s advantage to promote their new product because the public is not familiar with it.
examples.translate: 宣傳他們的新產品會對這家公司有利，因為大眾對它還不熟悉。

examples.example: Jason’s height gave him an advantage in the high jump competition.
examples.translate: Jason的身高讓他在跳高比賽上有優勢。

word_forms.definition_en: in the end, usually after a long period of time or many difficulties

examples.example: Raymond failed the GEPT the first time, but he tried again and eventually got an excellent score.
examples.translate: Raymond第一次全民英檢沒考過，但他再次嘗試，最後得到很棒的成績。

examples.example: Good training and a positive attitude led to Nicole’s eventual success as a designer.
examples.translate: 良好的訓練和正向的態度讓Nicole最後成功成為設計師。

word_forms.definition_en: a plan to trick people, either by catching them or by making them do something they don’t want to

examples.example: When the boy acted like he was crying, the mother fell into his trap and bought the cookies for him.
examples.translate: 當這個男孩裝哭時，他媽媽掉進他的圈套而買了餅乾給他。

examples.example: A tree that fell in front of the main door trapped the people inside the burning building until help arrived.
examples.translate: 一棵倒在大門前的樹困住了燃燒的大樓裡的人們，直到救援來到為止。

word_forms.definition_en: knowing or realizing something

examples.example: None of the students was aware that their teacher was actually a famous author.
examples.translate: 沒有一位學生知道他們的老師事實上是一位有名的作家。

examples.example: The main aim of World AIDS Day is to raise our awareness of AIDS.
examples.translate: 世界愛滋病日最主要的目標是要提升我們對愛滋病的認識。

examples.example: Although there is a growing environmental awareness in the world, many people continue to ruin the planet out of selfishness.
examples.translate: 儘管世上的環保意識日益增長，許多人因為自私而繼續破壞這個星球。

word_forms.definition_en: showing or done in a way that shows intelligent thinking

examples.example: The teacher was really impressed with the students’ clever ideas in their reports.
examples.translate: 老師對於學生們報告裡聰明的點子印象非常深刻。

word_forms.definition_en: to have a good chance of doing something

examples.example: The home team is likely to beat the visiting team with the support of all their fans.
examples.translate: 有了所有球迷的支持，地主隊有可能打敗來賓隊。

word_forms.definition_en: able to be reached from a certain distance

examples.example: Parents should never leave scissors or other dangerous items within arm’s reach of their young children.
examples.translate: 父母絕不該把剪刀或其他危險物品放在幼兒伸手可及的地方。

word_forms.definition_en: to make a line and wait for something

examples.example: The announcement reminded passengers to line up before they boarded the plane.
examples.translate: 廣播提醒乘客登機前要排隊。

word_forms.definition_en: to use or do something in a way that helps someone

examples.example: Some people took advantage of Eva’s kindness by asking her too many favors.
examples.translate: 有些人利用Eva的好心腸，請她幫忙做太多事。

word_forms.definition_en: to build something or put something together

examples.example: When it started to rain, the campers set up their tent immediately.
examples.translate: 天空開始下雨時，露營的人馬上架起帳篷。

word_forms.definition_en: to begin in a certain way or by doing a certain thing first

examples.example: Mia and Noah started off their journey in France, then traveled across Europe, and eventually returned home safe and sound to England.
examples.translate: Mia和Noah在法國開始他們的旅程，接著遊遍歐洲，最後安全返抵英國的家。
